intro: Phlox variabilis subsp. latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled phlox, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, clustered flowers that range from pink to lavender, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, moist soils. This subspecies is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
